column2: IPA: [ɐnˈgarsk]) is a city and the administrative center of Angarsky District of Irkutsk Oblast
column6: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 233

column1: It was founded in 1948 as an industrial community and was granted city status on May 30
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Angarsk serves as the administrative center of Angarsky District
column3: to which it is directly subordinated. As a municipal division
column4: the city of Angarsk and thirteen rural localities of Angarsky District are incorporated as Angarskoye Urban Okrug.

column1: As a result of the elections of December 2
column3: Leonid G. Mikhaylov was elected mayor. Previously

column1: Angarsk has the largest industrial zone in Asia. It includes Angarsk Petrochemical Complex and Angarsk Electrolysis Chemical Complex. Angarsk also hosts a showcase international nuclear fuel cycle center
column2: which will be one of the first Russian enrichment centers to be placed under IAEA safeguards. Angarsk is also the site for a Nuclear Fuel Bank
column3: following a decision by the IAEA in November 2009; working with Russia
column4: IAEA established this bank to supply market priced fuel to member states as protection against possible supply disruptions.In 2005
column5: Angarsk won the first prize in a nationwide contest for the fastest development of public utilities.

column1: The city is connected by the Trans-Siberian Railway. Trams
column3: and marshrutkas (routed taxis) are the main means of public transportation in the city.

column1: The city is home to the Angarsk Museum of Clocks and Watches
column3: and the Angarsk State Technical Academy.
